channel.title: Austin Delamar
channel.description: This is my blog about computers, programming, tech, and things that bother me. I hope it bothers you too.
channel.author: amdelamar

item.title: JavaScript Dependent Websites
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: If websites are like cake, then JavaScript would be the candles. But a cake without candles is still a cake. Right?

item.title: 2 Years Without Gmail
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: I switched to ProtonMail for better email privacy. I'm satisfied with my choice but its not without some drawbacks.

item.title: Video Game Trends that are Toxic
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: What's worse? Microtransactions, pre-order bonuses, yearly subscriptions, P2P networking, day-1 DLC, or something else?

item.title: Every Company needs a Web Developer
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: You'll also need lots of coffee to pay the developer.

item.title: Why I use Ad-Block
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: Online advertising had its chance, but plagued itself with spam, pop-ups, auto-playing videos, unregulated data collection, and even some unintentional viruses.

item.title: You should use Two-Factor Authentication now
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: Especially if you use a weak password for multiple websites. Enabling 2FA everywhere will help protect your internet identity from the next big leak.

item.title: What I learned 4 years after College
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: 4 years of classes followed by 4 years of work taught me: you never really stop learning.

item.title: Tips for building Java applications on Windows
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: exe wrappers, install/uninstall, fancy icons, shortcuts with java arguments, windows registry entries, and more options for java apps.

item.title: Problems with building your own blogsite
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: To build or not to build? That is the question. Sometimes building your own blog website can be beneficial. But not always.

item.title: Top 5 Java EE Tips and Tricks
item.author: amdelamar
item.description: 5 ways you can improve your Java EE web applications, with these tips and tricks.
